Tom Witzky.Action: Lies on Jake's bed reading him a story to help him fall asleep.
Closes the book, turns off the light, covers his son, and kisses him on the forehead.
Turns on the baby monitor after putting Jake to sleep to keep watch.
Lies on his son's bed reading him a story patiently until he falls nearly asleep.
Closes the book, turns off the light, covers his son, kisses him on the forehead, and thoughtfully turns on the baby monitor before leaving.
Turns on the baby monitor and carries the receiver carefully, listening to the baby's breathing.
Catches Maggie when she falls forward letting herself go into his arms and carries her piggy-back.
Engages in playful banter with Philip about the party, displaying social confidence and ease.
Kisses Maggie deeply and confidently at the party, indicating strong interpersonal and emotional confidence.
Philip catches up to Tom and throws his arms around him; Tom accepts the hug without resistance.
Tom grabs Maggie's arm and pulls her back close, telling her she is the one he wanted to hang with at parties for seven years.
Tom joins the men and responds friendly to Frank and Harry, accepting a beer and greeting them.
Tom immediately distances himself after hugging Philip and says he just found out about the pregnancy.
Greets Harry casually and acknowledges familiarity with the neighborhood.
Drinks beer as encouraged by Frank without protest.
Does not engage in or encourage Lenny's hostile or paranoid remarks.
Responds to Harry's greeting with a clear, confident statement about drilling holes in all the floors, showing he is actively working and straightforward.
Answers Harry's question about the neighborhood by indicating familiarity and practical knowledge of the area.
Saved Maggie's life when she was drowning at Jones Beach.
Saved Maggie's life by rescuing her from drowning at Jones Beach, displaying quick action and lifesaving skills.
Sits casually on the couch with feet on the coffee table next to the baby monitor during a party, showing relaxed but attentive behavior as a parent.
Volunteers to try something new when others refuse.
Makes playful, teasing remarks like 'Damn fine lookin' finger' and 'Can you clean out the nail, it's kinda makin' me sick here.'
Responds with hostility and threats ('Asshole', 'I'll clock you') to being jabbed in the eyes.
Complies promptly and confidently with Philip's hypnotism instructions without hesitation or confusion.
Uses casual, slightly irreverent language during a serious moment (e.g., 'I want to be fuckin' hypnotized, already'), showing comfort and assertiveness.
Responds with humor and good-natured sarcasm ('Hey, thanks a lot, it was very nice of you not to burn my flesh....') after being subjected to a prank.
Expresses confusion and discomfort but remains engaged with others despite feeling excluded ('He doesn't like this at all, being the only one not in on the joke').
Maintains composure despite confusion and awkwardness; questions what happened clearly and directly.
Appears disoriented and unsure about unusual physical sensations; shows signs of being the only one not in on the joke, indicating some lack of situational awareness.
Expresses humiliation and anger when friends mock him about childhood bullying, tries to deflect discomfort by urging others to participate instead of singling him out.
Lightens the mood after expressing discomfort, showing some degree of tolerance and attempt at camaraderie.
Throws his shoe out the window after the clock chimes, an impulsive act that triggers laughter among friends, suggesting a playful, not hostile, demeanor.
Throws a shoe out the window, laughs along with others, welcomes playful interaction with Philip by putting his arm around him in a friendly, humorous way.
Does not laugh at Maggie’s joke about having a girl and many brothers, seems distracted and serious instead of warm in response.
Engages in gentle physical contact with Maggie (allowing her to stroke his chest), indicating some intimacy and connection.
Focuses on practical concerns about work and house repairs, ignoring Maggie’s attempt to comfort him; shows some emotional distance or preoccupation.
Throws his shoe out the window impulsively without knowing why.
Engages playfully and confidently with Philip, showing his sense of humor returning.
Considers and plans to work Saturdays for another year or two to support his family, indicating responsibility and forethought.
Expresses frustration about the water leak and unresolved house repairs, showing awareness of problems but lacks action to get them fixed.
Lets Maggie kiss and touch him intimately, sharing vulnerability about his insecurities and aspirations.
Expresses frustration and agitation alone, but remains open and sincere with Maggie.
Squats down and gently puts his arms on his son's shoulders, speaks softly and asks if he is okay.
Reacting to his son's unexpected behavior with concern and attention rather than anger or dismissal.
Shakes his head and walks out of the room quietly without disturbing his wife or reacting harshly.
Notices Jake awake and stands attentively, approaches calmly, squats down to speak gently, puts arms on boy's shoulders, asks if he's okay, listens to Jake's cryptic advice with attentive curiosity.
Experiences intense pain and confusing visions but still takes Advil, splashes face with water, looks at himself in mirror, attempts to summon nerve and face what is coming.
Drinks orange juice rapidly and attempts to calm himself after disturbing visions.
Sits down and tries to regain composure silently in his living room; no direct social interaction shown.
Turns off the TV mute to try to hear the woman’s words, showing attentiveness and engagement.

Uses dismissive language about Philip, calling him 'a fuckin' clue,' showing impatience or disrespect.
Realizes static is blocking communication, mutes the TV to hear better.

Acknowledges uncertainty about what he experienced (hallucination or not) but keenly recalls details such as headache and thirst.

Appears unsure and unable to fully process the situation on his own, needing external help.
Promises Maggie he will talk to Elizabeth if anything like the hypnosis hangover happens again.
Shows irritation or impatience with Maggie by saying 'Maggie...' in a dismissive tone.
Responds to the football hitting his truck with surprise but quickly addresses the kids in a casual, non-hostile way.

Promises Maggie to seek help if the strange experience recurs, showing a measure of responsibility and awareness.

Acknowledges the upcoming record break by Kurt with good-natured acceptance.
Does not engage negatively with Harry or the police presence, staying observant and composed.
Expresses concern about the dent in the truck and potential docking despite it not being his truck, showing a sense of responsibility and awareness.

Starts the car and agrees to come to the game promptly, showing readiness and decisiveness.
Notices the police car arriving and pays careful attention, showing situational awareness and alertness.
Allows Harry to wait while he is distracted and does not immediately provide the rent check.

Stares at Dorothy for a long time, causing her to feel uncomfortable and avert her gaze.
Invites Dorothy to make herself comfortable and take off her coat.

Stands rooted and silent while Dorothy is being shown around, appearing distracted by a strange buzzing sound and staring intensely at Dorothy.
Attempts to get Dorothy to make herself comfortable, but does so awkwardly and is met with defiance.

Distracted and preoccupied during social interaction with neighbors, indicating possible emotional unavailability at the moment.

Fakes being fine by smiling and giving a casual excuse for his medicine intake, masking his true condition.
Drinks Advil dry and quickly, indicating urgency or recklessness rather than measured behavior.
Distraction and persistent headache disrupt his focus during social interaction.
Nods and complies with Maggie’s suggestion without hesitation, suggesting decisiveness.
Declines alcohol offered by Frank, possibly indicating self-control and respect for others' habits.
Glances up at streetlight and hears buzzing, then shakes it off without comment.

Declines an offer of schnapps from Frank, indicating self-control and good judgment.
Forces a smile when Maggie asks if he is okay, allowing her to show concern and remain close.
Allows Maggie to hold his hand and lean over to shout into his ear despite his distraction.
Forces a smile when asked if he is okay, indicating an attempt to maintain composure under pressure.
Tries to concentrate on the football game despite being distracted by a flashing light and a buzzing sound, showing some mental effort but impaired focus.
Turns attentively to Maggie when she shouts, tries to communicate despite overwhelming noise.
Leaps to his feet and rushes out into a dangerous busy street to find his son, ignoring his own safety.
Calls out for his son with concern, searches frantically through house and upstairs rooms.

Reacts quickly to a loud, painful noise by covering his ears and removing himself from the area.
Shows effective problem-solving by quickly retrieving keys and unlocking his door to check on his son.
Despite frantic searching and knocking around the house, fails to immediately locate his missing son.

Tells Maggie to take Jake home and promises to come soon, showing responsibility and care for family.
Runs after Dorothy who is distressed and nearly endangered, indicating concern for her well-being.

Grabs Dorothy's arms to stop her from running away, trying to protect her from danger.

Storms across the room and physically grabs Duane by the collar, confronting him directly.
Defends Dorothy fiercely against Duane, confronting and physically overpowering him after learning of his abuse toward her.

Freezes and shows Dorothy a photograph of her sister he recognizes.

Looks around the messy room, feels embarrassed and frightened by his own rage, suggesting a lack of emotional regulation.

Eager to leave the medical setting to return to work and daily life, showing focus but limited engagement with others' concerns.
Responds to medical news calmly and pragmatically, quickly shifting focus back to work and daily responsibilities.

Ignores Maggie's repeated requests to stop digging and take a break, showing inflexibility and possible lack of social awareness.

Dismisses Maggie's suggestion to call the police without considering her viewpoint, potentially showing closed-mindedness or impatience.
Expresses intense frustration and anger verbally towards Maggie, shouting and ranting.

Persistently digging the hole despite apparent emotional turmoil and conflict with Maggie.

Near neighbors (Lenny, Sheila) observe Tom working hard hauling heavy equipment into his house and basement.
Works with great strain and determination to set up and operate loud jackhammer in basement, showing personal commitment and enthusiasm (WHOOPS with joy).
Successfully maneuvers a heavy air compressor out of his truck and lowers it carefully into the basement through a trap door using a rope, demonstrating careful handling and planning.
Connects the compressor to the jackhammer and powers it up correctly, showing technical skill and understanding of the equipment.
Uses the jackhammer to split a rock blocking his way, maintaining control despite the difficulty and noise, indicating physical strength and practical ability.
Answers Maggie's call even when apparently busy, apologizes sincerely for past behavior and expresses desire to be with her.
Admits he was an asshole and accepts Maggie's criticism without defensiveness.
Reassures Maggie that he has stopped digging and things are back to normal, trying to ease her worries.

Gives a lame excuse about not using the truck for personal trips when asked why he can't come upstairs.
Quickly tries to dissuade Maggie from coming downstairs despite the situation with Jake, showing poor judgment in handling the emergency.
Slams down the phone and proceeds decisively by moving the table and dropping through the trap door to handle the situation below.
Works diligently and skillfully, descending into basement without using ladder, persistently breaking through rock with jackhammer.

Continues working with determination, leaps down into the hole and goes back to work after jackhammer completes breaking rock.
Abruptly stops digging when he notices something unusual (a shiny corner) and carefully investigates it.
Digs furiously in the basement to unearth a buried object, showing determination and persistence.
Sits down next to the decomposed body of Samantha Muller, struggles internally but ultimately reaches out and takes her skeletal hand in his own.
Pulls his hand away from Samantha but stops to stare intently at something in her fingers before climbing the ladder quietly.
Tom regains consciousness and immediately notices something unusual in Samantha's fingers, showing alertness and attention to detail.
He quietly and carefully climbs the ladder upstairs, indicating cautiousness and control in a tense situation.
Does not react impulsively or panic after waking in a disturbing situation, instead assesses surroundings calmly.
